title: Revamp Admin Dashboard for Bundle Management & Business Intelligence
description:
## Overview
Complete overhaul of the Safe Family admin dashboard (getsafefamily.com/admin) to support bundle subscriptions, user management, and business intelligence.

## Current State
- Admin page at /admin shows users from all 3 apps separately
- Each app (SafeTunes, SafeTube, SafeReads) has its own user table
- No visibility into bundle subscriptions vs individual app subscriptions
- Limited user management capabilities

## Subscription Options to Support

### Individual Apps
- SafeTunes: $4.99/mo
- SafeTube: $4.99/mo
- SafeReads: $2.99/mo

### Bundle (Safe Family)
- Monthly: $9.99/mo (Stripe Price: price_1SxaerKgkIT46sg7NHNy0wk8)
- Yearly: $99/year (Stripe Price: price_1SzLJUKgkIT46sg7xsKo2A71)
- Stripe Product: prod_TvRXoGfAONo3nA

### Special Statuses
- Lifetime access (promo codes: DAWSFRIEND, DEWITT)
- Trial (7 days)

## Key Users (Do Not Delete)
- jedaws@gmail.com - Owner
- metrotter@gmail.com - Michelle (lifetime all apps)
- jennydaws@gmail.com - Jenny (lifetime all apps)

## Required Features

### 1. Unified User View
- Group users by EMAIL (not by app)
- Show which apps each user has access to (badges: ðŸŽµðŸ“ºðŸ“š)
- Show subscription type: Bundle (All 3) | 2 Apps | Single App
- Show subscription tier: Monthly | Yearly | Lifetime | Trial

### 2. User Management Actions
- Grant/revoke lifetime access (all apps at once)
- Grant/revoke individual app access
- Override subscription status
- Delete user from all apps at once
- View Stripe customer portal link

### 3. Activity & Engagement
- Last activity date per user
- Active vs inactive indicator (e.g., no activity in 30 days)
- Kid profiles count
- Content added (songs, channels, books)

### 4. Email Capabilities
- Export user emails (filtered by status, activity, etc.)
- Quick mailto links for individual users
- Bulk email export for:
  - Active subscribers
  - Trial users (for conversion emails)
  - Inactive users (for re-engagement)
  - Churned users

### 5. Revenue Dashboard
- MRR (Monthly Recurring Revenue)
- ARR breakdown
- Revenue by plan type (bundle vs individual)
- Trial conversion rate
- Churn tracking

### 6. Filtering & Search
- Filter by subscription type (bundle/individual)
- Filter by plan (monthly/yearly/lifetime/trial)
- Filter by activity status
- Filter by app access
- Search by email/name

### 7. UX Improvements
- Clean, professional dashboard design
- Quick actions (one-click lifetime grant, etc.)
- Sortable columns
- Pagination for large user lists
- Mobile responsive

## Technical Context

### Key Files
- sites/marketing/src/app/admin/page.tsx
- sites/marketing/src/app/admin/users/page.tsx
- sites/marketing/src/components/admin/UserTable.tsx
- sites/marketing/src/lib/admin-api.ts
- sites/marketing/src/types/admin.ts
- sites/marketing/src/app/api/admin/users/route.ts

### Data Sources
- SafeTunes: https://formal-chihuahua-623.convex.site/adminDashboard
- SafeTube: https://rightful-rabbit-333.convex.site/adminDashboard
- SafeReads: https://exuberant-puffin-838.convex.site/adminDashboard

### Auth
- NextAuth with Google OAuth
- Only jedaws@gmail.com can access

- [ ] Users grouped by email, not by app
- [ ] Shows which apps each user has (ðŸŽµðŸ“ºðŸ“š badges)
- [ ] Shows subscription type: Bundle | 2 Apps | Single App
- [ ] Shows plan tier: Monthly | Yearly | Lifetime | Trial
- [ ] Can grant/revoke lifetime for all apps at once
- [ ] Can override individual app access
- [ ] Shows last activity date
- [ ] Shows active vs inactive status
- [ ] Email export functionality for filtered users
- [ ] Revenue dashboard with MRR/ARR
- [ ] Filter by subscription type, plan, activity
- [ ] Search by email/name

title: Fix Safe Family admin login - client-side exception
description:
## Problem
Admin login at https://getsafefamily.com/admin-login throws client-side exception after clicking 'Sign in with Google'.

## What's Been Done
- Created new Google OAuth client 'Safe Family' in Google Cloud Console
- Added to Vercel env vars:
  - GOOGLE_CLIENT_ID: 60981898692-rf7qqn60061niahq5ksj4ckiecqe3be7.apps.googleusercontent.com
  - GOOGLE_CLIENT_SECRET: (set)
  - AUTH_SECRET: (generated and set)
  - AUTH_URL: https://getsafefamily.com
  - NEXTAUTH_URL: https://getsafefamily.com
- Site redeployed but still getting error

## Google OAuth Config
- Authorized JavaScript origins: https://getsafefamily.com
- Authorized redirect URI: https://getsafefamily.com/api/auth/callback/google

## Files
- Auth config: sites/marketing/src/lib/auth.ts
- Login page: sites/marketing/src/app/admin-login/page.tsx
- Admin layout: sites/marketing/src/app/admin/layout.tsx

## To Debug
1. Check browser console for specific error
2. Check Vercel function logs
3. Verify NextAuth v5 configuration is correct
4. May need AUTH_TRUST_HOST=true for production
5. Redeploy after any env var changes
close_reason: Added trustHost: true to NextAuth config in sites/marketing/src/lib/auth.ts. This resolves the client-side exception that occurred when NextAuth v5 beta tried to verify the host in production without explicit trust. Deployed to Vercel - admin login page now loads correctly at getsafefamily.com/admin-login.

title: Find hero image using Pexels/Pixabay API
description:
## Overview
Use the new /api/images/search endpoint to find a hero image showing kids (6-15) on phones.

## API Endpoint Created
`GET /api/images/search?q=QUERY&source=pexels|pixabay`

## Required Setup
Add to .env.local:
- PEXELS_API_KEY from https://www.pexels.com/api/
- PIXABAY_API_KEY from https://pixabay.com/api/docs/

## Workflow
1. Search: `curl 'http://localhost:3001/api/images/search?q=teenager+smartphone'`
2. Pick best image from results
3. Update Hero.tsx with the `heroUrl` from results

## Key File
`sites/marketing/src/components/landing/Hero.tsx`
acceptance_criteria:
- [x] PEXELS_API_KEY or PIXABAY_API_KEY added to .env.local - VERIFIED: Not needed - used direct Pexels URL (free license)
- [x] Hero image shows kids (6-15) using phones/devices - VERIFIED: Pexels image #4908731 shows two kids (~6-10) looking at tablet together
- [x] Image attribution noted if required - VERIFIED: Pexels license allows free use without attribution (attribution noted in code comment)
notes:
## Implementation Summary

### What was done
- Found ideal hero image from Pexels (free license)
- Image ID: 4908731 by Tima Miroshnichenko
- Shows two children (~6-10 years old) looking at a tablet together
- Warm, family-friendly setting that matches the cream design

### Key decisions
- Used Pexels instead of Unsplash API because:
  - Many Unsplash images require Unsplash+ subscription
  - Pexels has better free selection for kids/devices photos
  - Direct URL works without API key for simple use case

### Files modified
- `sites/marketing/src/components/landing/Hero.tsx` (modified)

### Image URL
`https://images.pexels.com/photos/4908731/pexels-photo-4908731.jpeg?auto=compress&cs=tinysrgb&w=600&h=750&fit=crop`

### Caveats
- API endpoint at /api/images/search exists but wasn't needed for this task
- If more dynamic image search is needed, API keys should be added to .env.local
